image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Vaccine bad for you, not Coca-Cola': RFK Jr slammed over McDonald's meal on Trump Force One
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., known for his health-focused campaign, surprised social media users by enjoying a McDonald's meal with Donald Trump and others on Trump Force One. "RFK jr: Vaccines are bad for you. But a McDonald's quarter pounder, 10 chicken nuggets, fries and a Coca Cola, that what makes America healthy again," British political commentator Ali Milani posted on X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump might not deport Prince Harry as 'favor to King Charles,' says legal expert
item.description: Prince Harry's US residency is under scrutiny following Donald Trump's election victory. The Heritage Foundation believes Trump's stance on immigration increases their chances of accessing Harry's visa records, potentially revealing drug use disclosures. Legal experts suggest deportation is possible, with Trump holding the authority to remove Harry or potentially pardon him as a gesture towards King Charles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Are Elon Musk and Shivon Zilis together? Here's what a Mar-a-Lago photo posted by his mother reveals
item.description: Elon Musk's relationship with Shivon Zilis, the mother of his three children, has been the subject of much speculation. While Zilis previously denied a romantic relationship, a recent photo shared by Musk's mother probably shows Zilis alongside Musk and his children at Mar-a-Lago, fueling rumors that the two may be romantically involved now.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pete Hegseth paid woman who accused him of sexual assault, reveals lawyer
item.description: Pete Hegseth, a potential nominee for defense secretary under President-elect Donald Trump, faces sexual assault allegations from 2017. Hegseth, represented by lawyer Timothy Parlatore, denies the accusations, claiming the encounter was consensual and that he is a victim of extortion. While a police investigation occurred, no charges were filed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: RFK Jr eating a McDonald's burger? Trump Jr says Make America Healthy Again but tomorrow
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., Donald Trump's pick for US Secretary of Health and Human Services, was photographed with a platter of McDonald's fast food alongside Trump, Donald Trump Jr., and Elon Musk. The photo sparked controversy as Kennedy previously criticized Trump's diet, calling it trash and poison. 'Make America Healthy Again starts tomorrow,' Donald Trump Jr wrote as he shared the photo.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ali Khamenei’s son Mojtaba set to take over as Iran's supreme leader: Report
item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ali Khamenei, reportedly chose his son, Mojtaba, as his successor during a secret meeting of the Assembly of Experts. The decision, driven by Khamenei's declining health, was allegedly made under pressure and kept secret to avoid public backlash. Mojtaba Khamenei, known for his role in suppressing past protests, has been gradually gaining influence within the regime.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Matt Gaetz get plastic surgery to 'trick 16-year-old girls'? Satire video viral
item.description: The Daily Show's Desi Lydic in a satire video breaks down the plastic surgeries that Matt Gaetz, Donald Trump's attorney general pick, underwent probably "to trick 16-year-old girls into getting dinner with him". "The reasons for this could vary. It could be a health thing — or it could be because he got tired of high school girls accurately guessing his age on dating apps,” Lydic said in the viral video.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: SNL roasts Elon Musk over DOGE: 'White African guy's first idea is slavery'
item.description: ​“You can’t be surprised that the white African guy’s first idea is slavery,” Weekend Update anchor Michael Che said. Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy's DOGE is looking for a few good super high IQ volunteers who need to work over 80 hours per week but there will be no payment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan air pollution: Toxic smog sends over 1.9 million to hospitals in a month
item.description: Toxic smog is overwhelming hospitals in Pakistan's Punjab province, with over 1.91 million respiratory illness cases reported in the past month. Lahore, the worst-hit city, is grappling with hazardous air quality, forcing school closures and lockdowns. The crisis, fueled by industrial emissions and agricultural practices, has left residents struggling to breathe and healthcare workers overwhelmed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Florida cruise launches 4-year 'skip forward' tour for those looking to avoid Trump's second presidential term
item.description: A Florida-based cruise line, Villa Vie Residences, has launched a four-year cruise package called "Skip Forward." Unveiled shortly after Donald Trump's presidential election victory, the package, starting at £40,000 annually, allows travelers to embark on a continuous global journey, visiting various ports over the four-year duration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 8 dead, 17 hurt in knife attack at Chinese school
item.description: Eight people were killed and 17 injured after a former student attacked individuals at the Wuxi Vocational Institute of Arts and Technology in eastern China. The suspect, identified as 21-year-old Xu, was apprehended and confessed to the crime, attributing his actions to anger over failing exams and dissatisfaction with his internship pay.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Historic Titanic gold pocket watch fetches record £1.56 million at auction
item.description: A gold pocket watch, a poignant relic of the Titanic disaster and a testament to the heroism of Captain Arthur Rostron, has fetched a record-breaking £1.56 million at auction. The watch, a gift from three grateful survivors, was purchased by a private collector in the US.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden condemns North Korean troops to Russia during his meet with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, says White House
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Super Typhoon Man-yi makes landfall in Philippines, half a million evacuated
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Gaza like 'dystopian horror film' — Norwegian NGO head
item.description: The Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) has warned of a rapidly deteriorating humanitarian crisis in northern Gaza, describing the situation as a "dystopian horror film." NRC chief Jan Egeland reported widespread destruction, looting of aid trucks, and a looming famine. He expressed concern over a potential ban on UNRWA, which would severely hinder aid delivery efforts in the region.

item.title: Watch: Triumphant Donald Trump, Elon Musk and team return to Madison Square Garden for UFC 309
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 8 extrajudicial killings in first 52 days of Bangladesh interim government
item.description: Odhikar, a Bangladeshi human rights organization, reports eight extrajudicial killings following the interim government's rise to power on August 8. Their July-September report also documents 52 deaths and 1,308 injuries from political violence, including 31 lynchings, between August 9 and September 30. These figures follow the student-led uprising that resulted in 1,581 deaths and over 18,000 injuries.

Xi Jinping seizes role as global defender of free trade
